message.content:
<<<api>>>: StringTokenizer.nextToken
<<<code>>>: import java.util.Scanner;

public class StringArrayInput {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);
        String[] copy = new String[100]; // Assuming a maximum of 100 words

        int index = 0;
        while (sc.hasNext()) {
            String word = sc.next();
            if (word.equals("okay")) {
                break;
            }
            copy[index] = word;
            index++;
        }

        for (int i = 0; i < index; i++) {
            System.out.println(copy[i]);
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we create a Scanner object to read input from standard input. We initialize a String array with a fixed length of 100 (you can change this value as per your requirement). We use a while loop to read each word from the input until we encounter the word "okay". If the word is not "okay", we store it in the array at the current index and increment the index. Finally, we iterate over the array and print out each word until the index.
